comment.text:
Best meal we've had in Atlanta, ever!

My partner and I made reservations at the Betty and are so glad we did.

The service was impeccable. The staff were so friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. They have a great wine/drinks menu -- I had the Sancerre which was perfect.

We ordered the duck and pork chop as our mains-- everything perfectly cooked, not over or under done. The flavors were so complex and beautifully layered. The greens braised in coconut milk and spices. We also had a roasted cauliflower bisque which was AMAZING. So good. 

The food, ambiance, really such a special culinary experience. 

We can't wait to come back.  

The only regret was not taking pictures but we were so busy eating and enjoying everything. But the decor and plating of the food was so beautifully done.

Last night was our first time going there. Thursday nights are "Jazz Night"; live jazz and really good food were the perfect combination!
My wife isn't easily impressed, but she liked our date night. Our server was very friendly and attentive; she wasn't pushy, and she wasn't MIA. 
We started with the Deviled eggs - the smoked salmon and caviar was amazing! We ordered the steak and fries, and we loved it! It was a very nice date venue, and we plan on coming back with friends. They validate the valet parking (cost just  $10.00 to park).

The Betty is the perfect dinner spot for a swanky dining experience in the heart of Buckhead. 

Parking is valet only but discounted if you dine in with the Betty. So it's always a plus to grab a bite to eat or a quick drink at the Betty before or after your visit to Willow Bar or St. Julep. Otherwise, I recommend street parking right across the street from the hotel for free and walking over to avoid worrying about that at all (I've made that mistake a few times now and never again). 

I made a reservation to celebrate my 30th birthday here and invited a few friends to join me. We ordered a bunch of dishes to share and try. Everything we tried was delicious and beautifully presented. Loved the hamachi crudo and the pastas (cappelletti & spaghetti) were both tasty. The presentation on the sea scallops was gorgeous. The 32 oz prime ribeye was $169 - a bit pricy for what it was. It was super fatty (although I do enjoy my beef marbled) but since I ordered it medium rare, parts of the meat were borderline not rendered fully. But I loved the roasted garlic and madeira jus. My only other complaint were the sizes of the dishes overall were a little small for the price but otherwise a great meal. 

The meal isn't cheap but I definitely recommend experiencing it at least once on a special occasion.

2022 
again and ready for more.   The menu has changed ... $169 for prime ribeye.  Ok.  The food is very good!! 

The bread.... 
Hamachi crudo
Chicken liver
Scallops 
Beef cheek
Mushrooms

-------
Brunch Jan 2023
The Betty is great for a relaxed sophisticated brunch with no drama.  We were a party of 7.

The mushroom omelette was very popular.  It was good.  The short rib dish is so tasty!   The cheese grits were very salty, I would stay away from them.

owner_replies.comment:
Rene B.,
Thanks you so much for your kind words! We are absolutely delighted that you and your boyfriend enjoyed your delicious meal on our scenic patio. We'll see you next time for brunch!

comment.text: Came in for brunch a couple weekends ago with a friend. We made reservations for 11am on Sunday. It wasn't crowded. Our waiter was nice and attentive. We started with brunch cocktails. I got a lychee Bellini and my friend got the espresso martini. For food, I got the breakfast plate and subbed the brioche for potatoes. My friend got the Benedict. The food was really tasty! I'd love to come back to try their breakfast biscuit as well.

My hubby surprised me with a Valentine's Day dining experience at The Betty.  I've been wanting to try this place out for quite some time.  Service was wonderful from beginning to end.  We were warmly and immediately greeted upon arrival.  We didn't have to wait long at all to get seated.  Gregory took care of us the whole dining experience.  He came by often to check in with us which was so nice.  He made our dining experience very special.  

The interior is so stylish and really liked the vibe here especially in the hotel where this restaurant is located in.

They had a special Valentine's Day set menu which came with a glass of champagne or another non alcoholic option.  Loved that inclusive option of the non alcoholic drink!  I really liked all the options you could choose from even with the prix fixe menu.  With anticipation we waited for each beautiful food creation.  I have to especially give a special shout-out for the cool truffle presentation when you order it extra to top your food as well as the collard greens and mashed potatoes.  I'm a sides girl and loved both so much.  I'm a huge fan of greens and I absolutely loved The Betty's braised greens.  For our entrees we went with the pasta and skirt steak.  I really enjoyed the pasta dish and the steak was perfectly cooked.  The pasta also came with truffle.  The amuse of the beet cured salmon was so beautiful and honestly we could've probably had a whole tray of them.  They were esthetically on point.  I enjoyed the beef wagyu tartare that we ordered for the first round.  Now, I have to talk about the desserts that night.   Damn.  They were so so beautiful and tasted great!  I'm a huge strawberry lover and really loved the balance of flavor and combination of that dessert.  The other dessert we selected was a passion fruit one and that was so yummy too.  Felt like we were transported to a tropical island to have the freshest passion fruit ever.  Both were a great ending to our dining experience.  

I hope to make it back to try some of their other menu items and especially looking forward to The Betty's other dessert options.

A dope mention- I read that The Betty's and Ronald Hsu is a James Beard award semifinalist!  So awesome!  

One thing to note- Unfortunately they do not offer valet reimbursement so be prepared to pay $10 to park valet.  Please remember to bring cash to tip for valet.  There was not an option to add tip on the receipt when paying for valet with a credit card.

Pretty good breakfast sandwich on croissant, thick egg and delicious sausage. Good size, could split with someone. Situated in the hotel, not too bad priced either - was expecting worse. Service was great, cute little spot. Coffee was good. If i'm in the area or staying in the hotel, I'd come back.

The Betty is gorgeous. Very modern and posh. I love that as soon you walk in if feels romantic.  This is the perfect location for date night or celebrating an anniversary. The dim lighting, the place setting. But the down side is this restaurant is cozy. Not much privacy will be offered as they attempting to maximize the space. 

The food... Well I didn't check the menu prior to going which is totally my fault. So if you are a pescatarian I don't know if this is the best food option unfortunately. But I made the best of my experience. The bread was ummmm... interesting to say the least and not even sure that's the term I prefer to use. But yeah not exactly my favorite! We moved the next menu item which was the Hamachi Crudo, this by far my favorite dish of the night. The yellowtail was delectable, super fresh and sliced perfectly (I love a good steak cut). The aioli and lime was a match I didn't know I needed, mainly because I hate lime but this was delicious and refreshing 100/10 recommend. We also ordered the Mushroom risotto and the crab bisque. Okay so the risotto was FIREEE! Packed with flavor. And it's not technically a risotto the server explained it's a rice that they build up to give it that risotto-like consistency but either way it's so damn good! I mean this is a dish you can't go wrong with. 10/10 recommend for sure. The crab bisque... EHHHH! So I feel this could've been better if it actually had jumbo lump crab meat, but it did have the taste of blue crab. But the smoked trout roe was a needed element and the crème fraiche was the cooling factor similar effect of sour cream on chili. 

The parking is a breeze, just simply pull up. Valet will take it from there. I absolutely love the valet here. You can text them as your wrapping up dinner and they text you once your car is out front. They also provide the option pay to in advance. and its only $10.

Went for brunch. Food & Service were both great. The short-rib toast was yummy - would like a poached egg better but I didn't pay attention to what kind came with it. Bloody Mary was yummy too. 
I took a star away (and maybe should take two) because of valet. One issue is having to pay $10 for valet when having a full meal/not staying at the hotel and the restaurant not offering any sort of discount. The second is my car was returned to me COVERED with bird poop!! We had 5 cars in our party and mine was the only one. And the valet didn't even acknowledge the issue, just tried to walk away after handing me the key. So not only did I pay for the ability to eat at the establishment, I then had to pay to get my car washed!!

This place is amazing! The ambience alone is 5/5. I got the Risotto and lemon brûlée cheesecake. They were both divine. The cheesecake is def not "too sweet". The staff was wonderful, my server Tiana was fantastic! It's a perfect date spot.

The Betty was amazing! Honestly the breakfast was really top notch. 

I had the short rib toast and let me tell you, it did not disappoint. It came highly recommended by the bar tender and might I add, she wasn't lying. Lol. My partner had the bacon and egg biscuit which she enjoyed. 

I'll definitely be back when I visit ATL because not only was the restaurant good but my stay at the hotel was also amazing. 

5/5
Wow. It was deliciously superb. The food, ambiance and wait staff. I was so impressed with the while experience. I highly recommend it.

Great place for  Sunday brunch! The food was good, service great and the ambience is fantastic! A nice relaxing place to have Brunch in ATL! The only downside - no mimosas or alcohol before 12 pm on Sunday! But that's in the state of Georgia- really can't fault the restaurant for that!

This has been one of our go to spots for celebrations this year.
The Betty is located on the first floor of the Sylvan Hotel in Buckhead and is valet parking, so bring cash.  

Interior is gorgeous and even has outdoor seating which used to be available during the summer. One of the factors that keeps me coming back for more is their menu, which is always changing so it's a different experience every time!

Some of my favorites so far has been the seafood roast, lasagna rotolo, hamachi, and crab spaghetti.  Drink wise, the Retropolitan and the Pink Squirrel were the perfect cocktails. 

After a nice meal, enjoy the Atlanta skylines by going up to the rooftop bar at the hotel, St. Julep!

photos.caption: Beef cheeks - wasn't a huge fan

comment.text:
Found this place on Yelp, 4.5 stars overall? I decided I need to check out this place. I live really close to this place but I never know there is a hotel off East Paces Ferry. I finally know why. The Sobu Flats has been converted into a hotel called Kimpton Sylvan Hotel. Interesting. Upon entering walked into the hotel (The Betty is located inside the hotel), the extremely staff at the front desk greeted us and asked if we were heading to The Betty. So once you enter the hotel, turn left and the restaurant would be on the right at the end of the hallway.

FOOD 4/5
I ordered the Shrimp & Grits. The staff has told me there was this cajun bbq sauce in it which made it a little spicy. After checking it would not be too spicy, I was looking forward to trying out the shrimp & grits here. All of us enjoyed our brunch (Lobster Spaghetti, Mushroom Omelette, and French Toast). Three of us ordered the Orange Mango. Those juice, unfortunately, left a lot to be desired. There was too much ice and did not taste like anything. One of us even went further and said they tasted like some bad grocery store juice :(

AMBIANCE 4/5
The ambiance was good. Nothing really to complain about. I wish the entire back of the chair was covered. I could not put my bag behind me without the possibility of it falling on the floor. 

SERVICE 4/5
Our server, John, was very nice and friendly. The kitchen did not follow instructions though. One of us had a nut allergy but the kitchen still decided to put academic nuts on her french toast. I was quick to spot those nuts when the hostess was about to put that plate of french toast on the table. She quickly apologized and immediately removed the plate when we stopped her. She came back and told her the kitchen would make a new order of toast. Our server came and apologized, mentioned they put in the order with the right instructions. Oh well, sometimes kitchens do mess up orders like in many restaurants but they really needed to be careful when we talking about food allergies here.

It was overall a good place for brunch! So 4 stars from me to The Betty!

Service was very lackluster. It was like a drought had struck our table because our waters were perpetually empty. 

The server was very nice but seemed overwhelmed (with no help in sight) so we decided we'd just roll with it. 


Food was just, ok. Nothing stood out, besides the chicken dish (surprisingly tender, juicy & flavorful)

Ambiance is the only thing going for this place. Might head back for the bar, but that's it.
Portions were small, dishes were very poorly prepared, service was incredibly slow. Would not recommend this place at all.
Victoria is a next level bartender. She has amazing recommendations but also puts your taste first as a guest. Awesome experience.

One of the best in Atlanta

Ordered whole chicken and salt encrusted, and flamed table side whole fish. Amazing and spectacular service. Ask for Eddie.
I had the salad wedge as an appetizer and has the pork chop crispy potatoes and Brussels sprouts.

We had an anniversary dinner here
- all the food was amazing and the server was nice. The gin drink with the egg white was 5  along with their coconut roll and pasta with beef. Nice ambiance and cozy. Will be back again!

Enjoyed my night at the Betty located in Buckhead in the new Kimpton Hotel. The Betty has a long bar and bar area with high top tables. It also has booths for proper seating. 

I ordered the original martini($16) which was made well.  We ordered the cauliflower(fave dish), the duck, the chicken, and asparagus. The chicken was a large portion and the duck was very small. I think the entire menu is overpriced for what they offer, but the vibe was nice inside. There's nothing I'm eager to return to but it was fine. Service was a bit slow as I think they were understaffed. 

Reservations are recommended! Valet is $5(and may be validated but I forgot to ask).

owner_replies.comment:
Tari O.
Thank you for your review of The Betty! We are delighted you enjoyed our Cauliflower side! You'd be eager to hear that we also have a delicious breakfast and brunch menu that we invite you to try as well. We hope you try us again so that we can exceed your expectations on your next visit. Thank you!

comment.text:
Very good. Had a lovely experience and impressive flavors. It's a sexy little space too. 

Had a great laugh about the Celery Ceviche and ordered it because any chef with the audacity to serve a plate of celery for $11 sincerely must be doing something properly with it. Balanced flavors, and definitely creative. We roasted it, but it was undeniably delish. 

Chicken liver mousse was excellent. Oysters (Kumamoto) perfectly shucked and presented. Spaghetti with crab was perfectly al dente and delicious. 

Everything was sincerely just as it should be.

owner_replies.comment:
Jen C.
Thank you so much for your glowing review! We are delighted that you were delightfully surprised by our Celery Ceviche! Whenever you want a creative dish, we'll save you a seat!

comment.text:
The Hamachi Crudo alone is worth coming back for. Not only is it a feast for the eyes, but my friend and I both paused after the first bite STUNNED. Flavor, texture, presentation, is perfection. We agreed that the remaining citrus and poppy aioli(?) was worth drinking, and when the waiter came to remove the platter he joked that he takes knives first in case we're too reluctant to part with those leftovers.
Entrees came as small portions and were slightly less enjoyable, so indulge in multiple starters. The short ribs are more like a nice Sunday roast than the fall apart melt-in-your-mouth experience I was expecting, and the accompanying greens were good but shockingly bright/raw tasting. Cocktails were well balanced. The lemon brûlée cheesecake was a superb finish.

First time visiting...This is inside the Kimpton Hotel. Beautiful space, don't forget to check out the inner Willow Bar and upstairs rooftop bar. Great spots for an evening drink after dinner. 

Duck is great. Crab spaghetti is amazing. Hamachi crudo is also great. 

Just not enough food...not gonna lie, went for a late night chicken stir fry and beer afterwards lol. 

For a fine dining date night, definitely place to be to meet your tinder swindler.

photos.caption: Highly recommend making reservations or you'll sit closest to bathrooms(tiny tables away from bar&main dining hall...can feel secluded.
All in $149 w tip | Crab Spaghetti, Duck, Hamachi Crudo,  2 drinks(Hotel Nacional & Old Fashioned Betty)
View from tiny tables if you not make a reservation. Other view is the bar(see other pic)
Hamachi Crudo is delicious, citrus and sweeter
Crab Spaghetti is bomb.com. Smaller portioned...
Spiced Magret Duck | perfect Medium Rare, two thick slices. You'll need a midnight snack after this...

comment.text:
We came here for Brunch on Easter Sunday. We were enthusiastically greeted and made to feel welcome. The Betty had a warm intimate contemporary vibe that was very pleasant. This was a concern for us since this is part of a hotel.
No hotel lobby feel here 
Nia was our server and treated us very well. She had a very upbeat and positive energy and personality. 
We ordered the broiled salmon salad and the shrimp and grits. Both dishes were excellent. The salmon was perfectly cooked. The grits were top notch, and yes plenty of shrimp. Additionally there was also a bread basket with house made small muffins, bisciuts and pound cake. AND a plate of deviled eggs topped with smoked salmon.
and if that wasn't enough a glass of champagne for both of us.
The Betty is a well run establishment that I hope will be here a long while. We truly enjoyed our visit here.

First, let me start by stating that the restaurant is very nice inside and that our server was amazing.  My wife and I wanted to celebrate Valentines Day with a special meal. This is where things went downhill.  The menu presented was a preset menu.  The options to choose from were very limited and very elementary. The fish was terrible, grainy, and over seasoned. My flank steak was tough and grizzly. The side items arrived cold...our server did correct that by replacing the items that made it to our table warm.  Our last course, deserts, a cheesecake that was served still partially frozen, and a chocolate mousse that turned out to be more of a soft brownie texture made me realize that this establishment was ill prepared for the evening.  Not at all the experience we were hoping for, especially on a special evening. 
Could this have been an off night,  yes, but at our $$$.

Visited this place for the first time last week and WOW! What an awesome vibe- the decor was so beautiful and the service was beyond excellent. Our server was very knowledgeable about everything on the menu and the drinks were amazing. I have to say the espresso martini was probably the best I've had in atl so far!

Delicious.  What we selected for dinner consisted of oysters for an appetizer, hamachi for second course and halibut with brussel sprouts for main course.  The flavors of each were delicate and developed.  So good!  Service was appropriate, quiet and attentive.  Chef delivered main course.  Carrot cake dessert and espresso martini...great finish!  Setting is appointed well and music is quiet yet up beat offering a great back drop to conversation.  Recommend a date nite or small work group.

Great place to eat. Great service. I took the wife for her birthday. Appetizers will be around 20 dollars and main courses will be around 30 dollars. A steak is 169 dollars though. Portions are very small.

Literally the best, most flavorful food you'll eat. Really cool vibe, great service, fair pricing and overall amazing.

The oysters were incredible as well as the natural wine.

First time and it was a nice experience.  The manager came by our table and chatted for a few moments and actually shared some fun facts about the hotel amd sister properties.  We are locals and always enjoy a little tea in the neighborhood. :)  We ordered 2 entrees and 2 sides.  Note to self: The portions are generous and we weren't able to finish our meals although they were delicious!  We had the  Hamachi Crudo and it was good. We did feel that the portion wasn't as generous though. 
For Entrees we had the Basil Speghetti and the Halibut. Both very good! There were two tiny baby shrimp with the pasta dish.  We also had the Cucumbers and Crispy potatoes for our sides. There was enough for 6 people so we didn't finish those.  They were good just too much. Overall a good experience and would definitely try it again. Thank you!

Came here with my in-laws for cocktails a few nights ago. Had a guy bartender (longish curly black hair, black glasses) who was incredibly impatient & disrespectful towards me when I told him I had a food allergy. I bartend in NYC & I deal with ridiculous diets all the time, but I manage by being polite in a high pace atmosphere, with tourists, all while doing my best to make suggestions or substitutions. I asked what I could have on the food menu & he replied with "well that would depend on the ingredients now wouldn't it?" ... without any actual guidance. I had to press him to ask the kitchen because his knowledge was no help.
Another time that night I asked for a mezcal cosmo. If someone comes to me with the same allergy I have (glutens & grains) I know to substitute certain ingredients to fit their needs (ie. subbing the triple sec / Cointreau out for simple syrup). He makes me a regular cosmo with vodka (which I can't have) & with Cointreau. I taste it to make sure it's actually mezcal because he seemed overwhelmed & wasn't sure if he remembered my order. Ok so I make this for myself all the time & I know what smoky flavor to expect. This was NOT that. He insists it's mezcal then tries to flip the situation on me:
Me: this doesn't taste like mezcal, are you sure it's not vodka? I just want to make sure because I have an allergy to grains & I can't have most vodkas.
Bartender: It is mezcal, I just ran out of the other one I had that's why it tastes different. I guess I could remake it if you really want me to but I'm busy right now.
Mother in law: please, we'd really rather not go to the ER tonight.
Bartender: you know Cointreau is a grain based spirit too, right?
Sir, you should've swapped that for simple syrup instead.

The next morning at 10:15, there were 5 small groups of people waiting to be seated for brunch (like 2-4 tops). Even those with reservations were told to wait 15 mins even though every table inside was empty & they stop brunch at 10:30. In 15 mins brunch would've been over. One couple behind us lost patience & just pushed their way through, grabbed a table without a reservation. 

Food is good but service is terrible. Literally go to any other restaurant within a 2-5 min drive / 10 min walk.

I visited the Betty last Saturday with two friends. It was one  of the worst restaurant experiences I've ever had.  I made a reservation, but there was no hostess. There was a line of about ten people, but no one showed up for over 5 minutes. Turns out our, our other friend had gotten there early so we found him and sat down.  We waited another ten minutes (he had gotten their ten minutes before us), and no one came by our table to offer water or a menu. To be fair, we weren't having a uniquely bad experience. No one was receiving service. I went to the bar to get menus. Even there I couldn't get anyone's attention after another 5 minutes. We eventually decided to leave.  I get that restaurants are understaffed, but at a certain point it just makes sense to shut down for the day.

Check out The Betty nested in the Sylvan Hotel. Service is impeccable. Food is delicious and the plating is perfect.  The decor is swanky mid-century vibe.  So many delicious dishes. Here are my must haves: the duck, lasagna, and the lobster.

owner_replies.comment:
Nay A.
Thank you so much for your great review! We are so happy that you enjoyed your dinner here with us and can't wait to blow you away again next time!

comment.text:
A friend and I visited The Betty for a belated Mother's Day celebration.  We are local to Atlanta, parked down the street and walked the few blocks to the Kimpton to check it out.

My friend told me about the rooftop bar so we planned for drinks before dinner.  The rooftop bar, St. Julep, was a neat place. We took the elevator to the roof and landed in a hip and trendy spot for drinks.  I went to the bar toward the end of the roof and waited in line to order.  There was one bartender and two barbacks.  I waited what seemed like a while to order.  I ordered two drinks, one frozen and one cute and pink.  The frozen drink 'needed to come from inside' so I had to wait for that to be brought over from the other bar.  I paid and sat with my friend. The drinks were nice, the frozen one was way better then my Gin drink and twice the size for the same price. 

We made our way to The Betty and sat. We ordered our appetizers and entrees, we were hungry!  My friend ordered the Broiled Half Lobster and I ordered the 'Wedge' Salad'.  The food arrived and the lobster looked divine. The wedge left a lot to be desired.  Not the wedge I had in mind.  It was more like a few leaves of lettuce piled with seeds and herbs.  I was very disappointed.  You can't call it a wedge if it's not a wedge.  

After the salad left me hungry, the entrees finally came.  The lasagna I ordered was again, not what I expected.  It looked like a cinnamon roll but with cheese and mushroom. I was not into it at all.  I expected sauce and cheese and a bigger portion.  I left dinner hungry for sure.  

We went to pay and we had a Kimpton gift card.  Nobody knew how to run the payment.  The server took our cellphone Aline the restaurant to show her manager.  I felt uncomfortable my phone was taken away for so long.  Why didn't they know how to process this?  Finally, over 20 minutes later we were paid and ready to leave. 

I will not come back to The Betty, ever.  Food was not worth it and the bar drinks were overpriced for what they were.
Best desserts I've ever had. The Lemon Brûlée Cheesecake is so well balanced and light.

photos.caption: Lemon Brulee Cheesecake and Chocolate Entremet

comment.text: Yes! Another dining option in Buckhead that isn't a steakhouse or a hookah bar! Easy valet - super friendly and masked and careful. Enter the Betty - clean and swanky. Cool cozy booths (think velvet cushioned goodness). Ordered drinks and some cheese baked gougère arrived. Then a chilled lobster tail from the raw bar for starters. Followed by two orders of linguine with clams (and a few Calabrian chili pieces for kick). Added on a cauliflower cheese thing and Brussels sprouts with grapes side. Plenty of food for two - ended up with a lot to go! Oh - and some sorbet for dessert. Stephanie was attentive and knowledgeable.

owner_replies.comment:
Nicole P.
Ecstatic to hear that you enjoyed your feast! We'll congratulate Stephanie for her wonderful service to you-I'm sure she'll be excited to serve you next time!

comment.text: The Betty! My bf took me here for valentine's day this year, and it was so pretty inside! The environment has a more classic, dim-lit, sophisticated vibe, and there seemed to be some mixed reviews about the atmosphere being a bit pretentious. However, I thought it was nice and cozy. We did have to eat from their prix fixe menu in the event of valentine's, which we didn't mind so much. It was $110 per person with additional prices depending on what we order. We both ordered the Beef Wellington for our main (additional $45/per person), and we both got the oyster rockefeller and lobster thermidor to start off our meal. The apps were great, both quite salty, but flavorful. As for our main entree, beef wellington, the tenderloin was so smooth and tender, cooked about medium rare-rare. As for the service, we thought all staff were very friendly and attentive -- especially, the manager lady (?) would catch what we needed even before we asked and was thorough during her service. Anyways, all in all, food is on the saltier side but flavors were good and so was the service! Would recommend for a date night spot!

My boyfriend took me here on 12/8/22 and it was a great experience! Our waiter Eddie was EXCELLENT. He guaranteed a wonderful experience and he delivered! The food was delicious. The way Eddie described the dishes made us want to try everything.

Service was very slow, trying to find valet was very confusing and once inside hotel restaurant was difficult to find.
The deviled eggs almost tasted like sushi, based off the crust that formed on the outside of the yolk it seemed it was made in advance and left to sit, with shaved salmon on top. The mimosas were crisp and tart, they definitely did the job. The server brought out the deviled eggs about 7 minutes after it was ordered and then the food runner brought out the deviled eggs 20 minutes after we ordered them, poor communication between front and back of house. The eggs looked fresher than the ones we had been served. The eggs Florentine were amazing, the caviar added just the right amount of salt and fresh ocean taste, the eggs were cooked perfectly. The yolk burst into the plate when I cut into it.

owner_replies.comment:
Myron M.,
Thank you for your review! We're sorry to hear you had difficulties finding us and the valet and that your service was slow. We're glad you enjoyed your Eggs Florentine and hope to see you again soon, for a better dining experience. Thank you!

comment.text: There is only valet parking for this restaurant. It's in a hotel. So this automatically complicates parking. Valet for the Betty was disorganized and confusing. So be warned. The ambiance was nice but the seating (chairs) was very uncomfortable. We ordered heirloom pumpkin soup, spaghetti, Cornish rock chicken, prime rib steak and short rib with most of the veggie plates excluding the potatoes. The veggies were delish. My favorite were the broccolini. Steamed and seasoned lightly but perfectly. The cauliflower had a spicy surprise to it but yummy. The chicken was good but a little fatty. The spaghetti was the smallest plate. The birthday boy ordered it and basically we had to go to McDonalds after. He did say it was delicious just not worth the price tag for such small amount. The short rib was so fatty that our waiter had to apologize for serving us fat and provided us with another plate. This time there was actual meat. Overall, not sure if I return to this place.

Honestly, The Betty completely met expectations. My only qualm is that a place that expects at least a minimum of $100 a head charges you for extra bread haha but otherwise, this meal was spot on! It was only $4 for an extra order but at a place like this it felt slightly nickel and dime-y...but the bread was that good that I paid for more anyway!

The drinks were delicious and the Square Hammer was a favorite of mine as a whiskey lover. My wife had her taste of a few drinks and they were all great. 

We started with the oysters and lobster tail and let me tell you, the butter sauce on the lobster was fantastic! From there we went with the scallops, lasagna, and cauliflower; all delicious in their own right. The cauliflower with a fiery Asian flavor, the scallops deliciously accompanied by saffron, and a lasagna that had an unforgettable cheese. Our waiter, Eddie, advised us that this sounded like the "perfect" amount and it really was. One more dish may have been just a bit much. Topped off with espressos and the peach Bavarian for dessert, I am laying on the couch a happy camper after this meal! We will definitely be back to visit!

owner_replies.comment:
Ricky K.
Wow! Thank you for your kind words! The Square Hammer is one of my favourites as well! We await your next visit-happy to make you a happy camper anytime!

comment.text:
Got multiple pastas, apps, sides, drinks, champagne, wine and the daily salted fish. The food was incredible. The fish was $120+/pink snapper ($$$$), but it was worth every penny. The presentation and taste was delicious. I would eat that again. Joseph/joe was the name of the fish presenter (I think). Well done to him. 

The 1-star deduction was because of the service. We were underwhelmed by the service provided by our server. The drinks were okay. I shouldn't have to chase down our server when paying a $400 tab. 

Ambiance was nice. I would most likely return for the fish, but not sure if I would recommend versus other $$$$ restaurants.

owner_replies.comment:
Diego C.
Thank you for your feedback. I am saddened to hear that your service was underwhelming; this is definitely not what we strive for. We always aim to put our best foot forward and are sorry that didn't happen for you. We hope you will give us another chance to blow you away, not just with our food and ambiance, but also with our drinks and an outstanding personal experience. We hope to see you again.

comment.text:
The ambience, service, setting, parking accommodations were all fantastic 4/5 stars for sure. However the food was not that great, sadly. I had the lasagna and it was just bland and not well dimensioned flavor-wise, really like it came from a frozened bag. The scallops seem to be a bit more tasty though, the portion sizes were a little small, as scallops tend to be, so no big deal there. 

We also had the sorbet for dessert which was fine, it's pretty hard to mess up two scoops of strawberry sorbet. I had a glass of Prosecco and my guest had the Daiquiri cocktail which were both fine and again very hard to mess up. 

I may have picked the "wrong dish" from the menu because I was really hoping to have something flavorful and unique to dine on. I will return to the Betty to try one more dish from the menu, but was not at all happy that my first time was a bit of a miss. Here's hoping for better next time.

owner_replies.comment:
Kay M.
We are disappointed to hear that your first time dining with us was a bit of a miss. We look forward to seeing you next time and hopefully blowing it out of the park for you. We'll see you soon!

comment.text: Read several negative reviews but decided to come anyways. So glad I did. The Broiled Red Snapper is the best gosh entree I've ever had. The lemon brûlée cheesecake is NOT to miss either! Had a 5 course meal here. I don't wanna see my bill. LOL

Cute crystal-like hand sanitizer dispensers that match the candles and glassware? Check. That was a good first impression of The Betty. So too was the good amount of space between each table of diners. We were excited to try the supper club-themed restaurant after seeing several reviews, and were not disappointed. The menu is interesting, the plating is pretty perfection, and the bread service is worth the visit alone. Think King + Duke's popovers, but lighter and cheesier. The menu had 4 appetizers, 4 pastas, a raw bar menu, several entrees and some higher end sharing entrees. Hands down the best dish? The cauliflower side... with a Parmesan aioli, chili and pine nuts, large enough for 2 to share, small enough to enjoy all to yourself with a lighter entree. We were dismayed to find the much applauded Shrimp Cocktail wasn't on the menu that night, but everything else made up for it. Honorable mention for the Poached Halibut and great wine pairing suggestions. Top marks, Kimpton.

photos.caption: Lemon bar dessert with fresh strawberries
Chicken Liver Mousse with gorgeous floral garnish

owner_replies.comment:
Emma H.
Thank you for your astounding review! Call ahead next time and we'll let you know when the Shrimp Cocktail makes a reappearance-it's divine! Or you can always come back for more of the Poached Halibut and Cauliflower side or to try something new. Until next time!

comment.text:
I don't know. There was something about the vibe here that felt so inauthentic. It feels like you're legit walking into a movie and everyone is pretending to be pretentious in order to convince us that it's fancy LOL. 

We didn't know everything was taps until we were about to order. While the food was good, the prices didn't reflect taps prices so that was a little strange! 

It's definitely work trying out, but after staying at the Kimpton for a weekend, this was not our favorite spot in the hotel.

owner_replies.comment:
Evelyn N.
We are saddened you didn't feel our authenticity here at The Betty. We strive to empower each employee to be their own genuine self and hope you give us another try to have each of our individual personalities shine through. Regarding 'taps': would you mind reaching out to our Assistant General Manager Ally at ally.walker@thesylvanhotel.com so we can better understand and address this issue. Thank you!

comment.text:
Eddie, our server, made the evening exceptional. His knowledge of the menu, professionalism, and superb recommendations (mezcal Negroni, for example)  convinced us this is now one of our favorite restaurants & will be back very soon. :) 

The food and drinks were phenomenal. The best dining experience in years. Reminded us of 2019 days.
- hamachi crudo is a must 
- snap pea salad is a perfect, light starter with a lot of flavor
- ricotta gnocchi.. order it.. you won't regret it 
- NY strip had an amazing reduction; great cut of meat (the butcher is also the owner of the farm where it is sourced)
- lemon cheesecake is just as good as all the reviews say
Drinks were great. Staff was friendly. I'll definitely return. Only knock is the drinks are a little pricey. But I'm guessing it has a lot to do with the location. If I could I'd give it a 4.8
